@adocomplete @hayesdev_ This is basically least-privilege for agents. Pre-approve deterministic, idempotent ops; gate state-changing actions; hard-block irreversible ones. You cut cognitive interrupts and reduce blast radius, Exactly how human + agent workflows should be designed.

@adocomplete those 3 tiers are game-changing, but most still ignore "deny" for dangerous ops.  set deny on anything touching prod env vars or external apis first.  
saved me from a few scary accidental deploys already.

@adocomplete @bcherny This is needlessly complicated. @droid permissions (on level Medium) block things that are not reversible (git push, rm of stuff not in git). It requires no config, and it is easier to understand than "blocks dangerous stuff".
